Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Transcatheter Aortic Valve Replacement and Surgical Aortic Valve Replacement

Trial_Design.evidence: This meta-analysis included eight randomised controlled trials (RCTs) with a total of 18,671 patients.

Participants.evidence: Studies comparing TAVR and SAVR outcomes in adults were included.

Intervention.evidence: This study aims to compare the outcomes of transcatheter aortic valve replacement (TAVR) versus surgical aortic valve replacement (SAVR) in patients with aortic stenosis (AS).

Objective.evidence: This study aims to compare the outcomes of transcatheter aortic valve replacement (TAVR) versus surgical aortic valve replacement (SAVR) in patients with aortic stenosis (AS).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was all-cause mortality at 30 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 18,671 patients were randomised, with 9,336 to TAVR and 9,335 to SAVR.

Result_Outcome.evidence: All-cause mortality was lower in the TAVR group (2.48% vs. 3.03%), with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.79 (95% CI: 0.63â€“1.00; P = 0.05).

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was registered in the Open Science Framework (OSF.IO/X35KY).

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by unspecified sources.
